tool.name: reliability

param.name: in_poly
param.dialogReference: The restoration site area being assessed. All other input datasets will be re-projected based on the projection used for the restoration sites. All fields and spatial data in this dataset will be copied to the output. The output table from one partial analysis can be used as input to the next.

param.name: cons_poly
param.dialogReference: Polygon dataset defining areas to be conserved or otherwise protected against future threats and development. Suggested sources include state planning organizations.

param.name: Conservation_Type
param.dialogReference: Values in the field which are protected.

param.name: bufferUnits
param.dialogReference: Buffer distance around the restoration site that will be considered to determine the reliability of benefits from each site. The default used in the Full Indicator Assessment is 500 feet.

param.name: outTable
param.dialogReference: A file name and location must be specified for the dataset that results from the analysis. It is recommended that users create a new file geodatabase and save their output there because the output file folder location is also used to save intermediate files. If a file saved in the specified location shares a name with any intermediate it is deleted and overwritten.

tool.summary: The Benefit Reliability Tool calculates the reliability of site benefits in the same way as the Full Indicator Assessment Tool. The difference is this tool has an added Buffer Distance parameter.
tool.usage: Calculate values for reliability of benefits coming from each site in the future. Results are added to "Conserved" and "Threatene" fields in the output table and are calculated as the percent of the area in the specified buffer that is designated as conserved.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: The Benefit Reliability Tool calculates the reliability of site benefits in the same way as the Full Indicator Assessment Tool. The difference is this tool has an added Buffer Distance parameter.

searchKeys.keyword: Benefit Reliability; RBI; Rapid Benefit Indicators; Ecosystem Services
